numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This scatter plot represents data between two discrete variables.
2. The two variables have a moderate positive correlation.
3. The scatter plot shows that young adults are more optimistic than adults who are 40 years old or older.
4. A young adult is a person who is between 15 years old and 24 years old.
5. The audience can be psychologists.
6. The audience can be therapists.
7. The audience can be counselors.
8. The audience can be any person who is concerned about mental health.
9. The scatter plot can direct the audience toward pessimistic adults.
10. The scatter plot can encourage the audience to offer help to pessimistic adults.
11. One interpretation is that the world is becoming a better place.
12. This interpretation says that present young adults did not experience as much pain as adults who are 40 years old or older experienced when they were young.
13. Another interpretation is that older people learned negativity through life experiences.
14. If older people learned negativity through life experiences then older people are less optimistic.
15. Some young adults have big dreams about their future career.
16. Some young adults have unrealistic dreams about their future career.
17. Some young adults have big hopes about their future lifestyle.
18. Some young adults have unrealistic hopes about their future lifestyle.
19. Some young adults have big hopes about their future income.
20. Some young adults have unrealistic hopes about their future income.
21. As young adults age, they realize realities about how the real world works.
22. If people realize these realities then these people can become less optimistic.
23. The purpose of this scatter plot is to compare how two groups of people view the world.
24. The purpose of this scatter plot is to contrast how two groups of people view the world.
25. The scatter plot provides data for any person who is interested.
